N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 7 ยง 51.20 - Emergency situations

State Regulations

In situations of an emergency nature, such as escapes, disturbances, etc., the cooperation of the news media is requested in that
inquiries and information interviews be reasonably limited. The public
information officer or his or her designee will issue periodic updating reports
and will be available for interviews as he/she deems necessary. Emergency
situations call for extensive effort on the part of the entire agency. While
every effort will be made to keep information current, the emergency of the
situation must be respected and the cooperation of the news media will be
appreciated. When a correctional facility is placed under a "state of
emergency," news media access will be limited consistent with the criteria
established in section
3.20
of this Title. Approval and designated areas shall be at the discretion of the
commissioner or his or her designee. Notes
